H0.text: It decreases the cost of cars, which is how improving the design of seat belts helps people the most.

H1.text: It increases the speed at which cars can travel, helping people the most because almost all cars today have seat belts.

H2.text: It decreases injuries to passengers in cars, which is how improving seatâ€‘belt design helps people the most, given that almost all cars today have seat belts.

H3.text: Improving seat belt design helps people the most by increasing the comfort of passengers in cars, since almost all cars today already have seat belts.

A4.text: NHTSA estimates the resulting increased seat belt use saves 10,000 per year in the United States.

A5.text: Seatbelts limit the forward motion of an occupant, stretch to absorb energy, to lengthen the time of the occupant's negative acceleration in a crash, reducing the loading on the occupants' body.
